intro: Verbascum tzar-borisii, commonly known as the Tzar Boris II mullein, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Bulgaria. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
